Title: Linking forum posts -rprog-003-4-T1.1
Description: The workers will be presented with posts from a forum thread where instructors of a course have replied to student posts. The worker is required to: identify the student post(s) that the instructor’s reply addresses. Instructor's reply post is highlighted
Keywords: tagging, categorization, discussion forum, forum threads, mooc
RequesterFeedback: Hi, if many posts are being replied to, please only mark the first relevant post.
Input.posts:
For this question I had to take the quiz three times before the correct answer appeared in the list for me to choose. It was not present at all the first two times. Has anyone else seen this? Was it just magically fixed by a TA between my second and third times? I would cite specifics, but that would give away the real answer.
Upvotes:
16
I think I'm having the same problem. I got an error on another question so when I redid the quiz ... the only answer I consider to be correct for Q3 has disappeared, and now I think I'm faced with four choices, all of which are incorrect? Staff/TA's could you please have a look. I'm happy to send example if that helps. Thanks J
Upvotes:
5
I've got the same problem. The first time there was no correct answers.
Upvotes:
3
Input.inst_post:
Instructor's Post
Screen capture the quiz so you can provide 'proof' of your claim when you open a support request with Coursera. You can view previous quiz results and screen capture then as well if necessary.
Instructor's post : Screen capture the quiz so you can provide 'proof' of your claim when you open a support request with Coursera. You can view previous quiz results and screen capture then as well if necessary.

I was very confused by this question: Question 10 In R, what is the parent frame? It is the environment in which a function was defined It is the package search list It is the environment in which a function was called It is always the global environment I got it wrong three times, so I'm pretty sure the answer is 'the environment in which a function was called,' but I don't understand this. I've been over the lectures on this and I've done some Googling, but to no avail. I think part of my confusion is that I don't understand the difference between (or the relationship between) and environment and a frame .
Upvotes:
0
Input.inst_post:
Instructor's Post
This article on StackOverflow might shed some light on the differences between frames and environments. You can read more about frames and environments in R in this document .

It is the environment in which a function was defined It is the package search list It is the environment in which a function was called It is always the global environment I got it wrong three times, so I'm pretty sure the answer is 'the environment in which a function was called,' but I don't understand this. I've been over the lectures on this and I've done some Googling, but to no avail. I think part of my confusion is that I don't understand the difference between (or the relationship between) and environment and a frame .
